comments.en:
Epson provides a free (LGPL) driver for this printer. With this the printer should work to its full extent.

Unfortunately, Epson's "epl5900" driver (or perhaps the printer's firmware) is somewhat buggy. It prints most documents, but images converted to PostScript with "convert" or by the built-in filters of CUPS leads often to incorrect printouts (stretched by a factor of 3 or 4 in horizontal direction).

Further tests with the "pxlmono" driver did not show this problem. The printer works perfectly in 1200 dpi with this driver, only full-page photos take very long to be rendered.

It is really strange that the native driver from Epson does not work correctly but a driver for an emulation mode.
